title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: [517] Viz, Faldonside, an estate adjacent to Abbotsford which Scott hadlong wished to possess.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: _May 24, [Edinburgh]._--Called on my neighbour Nicol Milne ofFaldonside, to settle something about the road to Selkirk.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I laboured with littleinterruption, excepting a walk as far as Faldonside with the dogs, andat night I had not finished more than three leaves.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: A tinker (drunk I suppose) entered the streamopposite to Faldonside with an ass bearing his children.

title: Stories from Scottish history /
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: George Douglas, who struck the first blow, and Ker of Faldonside, another ruffian who offered his pistol at the Queen's bosom in the fray, were exempted from the general  pardon.

title: Over-sea;
author: Morford, Henry
snippet: The fierce fanatic Ruthven, hollow-eyed, and a consumptive skeleton under his armor ; the handsome, worthless Darnloy, hypocrite as well as vacillator ; the dark, daring, ambitious illegitimate Postulate George Douglas, first to strike, with least cause of all ; the thin, savage K^r of Faldonside, with the petronel in his hand, ready to present even at the bosom of the wretched queen so soon to be a mother.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: He is very desirous of parting with his estate of Faldonside, and if he will be contented with a reasonable price, I am equally desirous to be the purchaser.
